Migrant nail technicians to receive $230,000 in compensation from Wellington nail salon https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/migrant-nail-technicians-to-receive-230000-in-compensation-from-willington-nailton-nailton-nailton-nail-nail-nail-nail-nail-nail-nail-salon/bbvxijtxijjjjjjjjjmxgvh7vb5v4am/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/migrant-nail-technicians-to-receive-230000-in-compensation-from-willington-nailton-nailton-nailton-nail-nail-nail-nail-nail-nail-nail-salon/bbvxijtxijjjjjjjjjmxgvh7vb5v4am/ The women, who often worked every day without breaks, were initially paid $200 per week. Bombay interchange traffic lights: Locals outraged at long delays as NZTA activates new lights https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/nz/bombay-interchange-traffic-lights-lights-locals-outraged-at-long-delays-aas-nzta-activates-new-lights/qsjq3vrk6bbobc4zbbobc4zb6q2g2g3quuy/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/nz/bombay-interchange-traffic-lights-lights-locals-outraged-at-long-delays-aas-nzta-activates-new-lights/qsjq3vrk6bbobc4zbbobc4zb6q2g2g3quuy/ Benjamin PlummerNZTA says queues will improve as the software adapts and motorists adjust. Fri, 28 Feb 2025 06:41:16 +0000 Locals in the South Auckland community of Bombay are outraged after new traffic lights were activated overnight, causing extensive delays during rush-hour morning and afternoon traffic. Queues on Mill Rd stretched at least 2km this morning as commuters made their journey to work after the lights – at the Bombay Interchange and adjacent BP Bombay service centre exit – were livened at 2am on Friday.
Photo / Supplied
